ygData.subject: Re: Jewelcraft...skill at 200
ygData.msgSnippet: Ok, here are my findings as well.. My skill is 200, when making items with plat, I ALWAYS buff my wis, so far my current buffed wis is 151. Do note, I haven t
ygData.messageBody:
Ok, here are my findings as well..
My skill is 200, when making items with plat, I ALWAYS buff my wis, so far
my current buffed wis is 151. Do note, I haven't focused on keeping my int
buffed max vs. my wis. I recently have made some very hard items, my
failure rate was less than 20% and in some cases 0% failure (depending on
each gem). In additional buffs, I always buff every stat I can (being a
level 50 Enchanter we get a couple). Now dont get me wrong, some days, I
cant make a plat sapphire necklace to save my life. Usually I'll zone after
3-5 tries and try again in the next zone, this usually breaks the bad run
on luck, or whatever. The bottom line, least to me, wis does play a part,
but so do ALL of our stats, Im sure.
Also, along the same lines in another subject, I've herd a CHA of 130+ is
when charm really kicks in. So, if the same applies to wis, it would stand
to reason, we shouldn't see much if any with a wis of 130 or less.
